intro: Psychotria peduncularis var. nyassana, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are known for their strong, sometimes unpleasant odor. The plant is also notable for containing psychoactive alkaloids, similar to those found in other species of the Psychotria genus.
